Articles.Content:
Bought KSP a week ago and been hooked ever since! What a great concept for a game, combines humour, exploration, building and pretty good space physics. I learnt more about orbits and rendevous in 1 week with this game than years of occaisional reading about the space race, I love the map view as its so intuitive!

Hope to post more soon and get some ideas of what more fun I can have with this excellent game.
Yes it is a fantastic game and teaches lots! haha

Yep great game, been playing about a month now myself.

I have a friend who has just finished a games design degree and he said it's not bad but reminds him of a physics game for kids. WTF is he on about, if my kids could understand the maths/physics/engineering that go on in this game I'd be ultra impressed.

G.

Welcome to the community Kerolyov

What you do in KSP is up to you and your imagination, how about making a space hotel that can take Kerbals around the solar system on a sightseeing tour?

Have fun exploring the possibilities, and fly safe!
Welcome to KSP hope you have a great time playing this amazing game. I recently brought this game and I never regretted it!

I do wonder what your friends lecturers taught him if he cant see the appeal of KSP. I'm a hobbyist games programmer myself and I think its a very innovative design not just a kids education game! This game brings so many fun elements together and one of the rare games that is fun without needing to shoot something (other than Kerbals into space!)

Yep great game, been playing about a month now myself.

I have a friend who has just finished a games design degree and he said it's not bad but reminds him of a physics game for kids. WTF is he on about, if my kids could understand the maths/physics/engineering that go on in this game I'd be ultra impressed.

G.

His lecturers would probably say that it's a great game. I just think a big percentage of gamers are like sheep now following the herd. I'm a programmer/student studying computer science (1 year left... yippee:)) and I see more than a great game in KSP. As for my friend he's a fool who loves the AAA titles that keep coming out with a new number every year.
